        public DeviceInfo()

    • Method Detail

      • getAvailableRamMemory

        public static long getAvailableRamMemory()
        The available memory on the system. This number should not be considered absolute: due to the nature of the kernel, a significant portion of this memory is actually in use and needed for the overall system to run well.
        Returns:
        long - The available memory on the system.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getTotalRamMemory

        public static long getTotalRamMemory()
        Notice target API above 16 (Jelly Bean). The total memory accessible by the kernel. This is basically the RAM size of the device, not including below-kernel fixed allocations like DMA buffers, RAM for the baseband CPU, etc.
        Returns:
        long - The total memory on the system. In case API under 16, it will return the available memory instead.

      • getUsedRamMemory

        public static long getUsedRamMemory()
        Notice target API above 16 (Jelly Bean). The memory used by the kernel and other applications.
        Returns:
        long - The memory used by the system an other applications. In case API under 16, it will return invalid value (-1).

      • isLandscapeMode

        public static boolean isLandscapeMode(@NonNull
                                      android.content.Context context)
        Whether the screen orientation mode is landscape, no matter if the screen angle is 90 or 270 degrees.
        Parameters:
        context - Context - The context which the activity is started in.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - - In case the Context parameter is NULL, the method will throw NullPointerException.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getScreenOrientation

        public static int getScreenOrientation(@NonNull
                                       android.content.Context context)
        The device screen orientation in degrees. Could be a value of 0, 90, 180, or 270, and dependce on the device manufacturer. Default see Configuration.ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE} and Configuration.ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT.
        Parameters:
        context - Context - The context which the activity is started in.
        Returns:
        int - Screen axle direction in degrees.
        Since:
        1.0
